intro: Ayenia simulatrix, commonly known as the false heath, is a member of the Ericaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features dense clusters of small, leathery leaves and produces bell-shaped, pink or white flowers. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. Ayenia simulatrix is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
